*** Bug 40903 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Ted:

what is the locale when you run locally on HP (with success). Is it the same 
as the one you mention in comment 1?

Is the following correct?
- 2.1.1 always runs locally on your HP box regardless of the locale (C, en_US).
- the problem only occurs when running from a remote linux box with the 
locale "C". It works remotely if the locale is set to en_US.iso88591.

2.1.1 always seems to run locally (with locale set to "C")
The problem occurs any time you run eclipse remotely.
I tried it on a Solaris box as well, with the display exported.
It will work if the locale is set to an existant english locale.
The reason why I believe this defect to be serious is because this is the 
default setting.
Most Unix boxes out there come with their locale set to "C" by default.
I also believe that most people who work with HPUX systems do not work with the 
HP box as their desktop machine.

Current workaround is to change the locale on the HP box from the default C 
one to "en_US.iso88591" for example.
*** Bug 40902 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Fixed > 0808 with SSQ.  For some reason the C locale was causing problems with 
FontSets, so in this case we now use a Font struct instead.
